intro: Hieracium minutulescens, commonly known as the small yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy stems. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in meadows and disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped. It is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
